titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 451: Three itineraries

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (Zacour-Hirsch). Title on title page in a later hand on different paper (f. 1r): Viaggio di Spagna et Portugallo del clarissimo Signor Costantin Garzoni. Title on spine: Garzoni Viaggi M.S.
1st work: Fontana's Itinerario, overo viaggio da Venetia a Roma..fino a Santo Iacobo in Galitia, Venice 1550, appears to be based on this account.
A ms. copy of the Relatione di Portogallo di Costantino Garzoni is in the Bibliothèque de Carpentras.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msItem.title: Description of a pilgrimage from Venice to Santiago de Compostela, f. 2r
Description of a journey from Venice to Milan, f. 28r
Description of a journey from Venice to Rome, f. 32r

supportDesc.extent: 69 leaves : 153 x 102 mm. bound to 158 x 105 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (modern paper) + 69 + i (modern paper); [1-69]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto. A few leaves are missing at the beginning.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in italic and cursive scripts by two or more hands.

binding.p: 19th-century half calf; upper hinge split and nearly detached.

origin.p: Written in Venice between 1541 (f. 27r) and the end of the 16th century.

history.provenance: Sold in the collection of Walter Sneyd at auction at Sotheby's, 16 Dec. 1903, lot 317.

keywords.term: Christian pilgrims and pilgrimages--Europe--Early works to 1800
